en.purpose: To calculate estimated post-transplant survival score
en.use:
The factors included in the formula for EPTS score are the patient’s age in years, duration on dialysis in years, current diagnosis of diabetes, and whether the candidate has had a prior solid organ transplant.

The formula for the raw EPTS score is:
0.047×max⁡(Age−25,0)+(−0.015)×Diabetes×max⁡(Age−25,0)+0.398×Prior solid organ transplants+(−0.237)×Diabetes×Prior solid organ transplants+0.315×log⁡(Years on dialysis+1)+(−0.099)×Diabetes×log⁡(Years on dialysis+1)+0.130×(Years on dialysis=0)+(−0.348)×Diabetes×(Years on dialysis=0)+1.262×Diabetes.0.047×max(Age−25,0)+(−0.015)×Diabetes×max(Age−25,0)+0.398×Prior solid organ transplants+(−0.237)×Diabetes×Prior solid organ transplants+0.315×log(Years on dialysis+1)+(−0.099)×Diabetes×log(Years on dialysis+1)+0.130×(Years on dialysis=0)+(−0.348)×Diabetes×(Years on dialysis=0)+1.262×Diabetes.

The percentage is derived from the raw EPTS score using the EPTS Mapping Table.
en.misuse: Not to be used for recipients of multi-organ transplants and patients aged less than 20 at the time of transplant.

other_details.en: The Estimated Post Transplant Survival (EPTS) score is a numerical measure used to allocate some kidneys in the kidney allocation system. Every adult patient on the kidney wait-list receives an EPTS score for use in the kidney allocation system. EPTS scores range from 0% to 100%. Candidates with a lower EPTS score are expected to experience more years of graft function from high-longevity kidneys compared to candidates with higher EPTS scores.
